column2: _APRIL._
column3: underscore APRIL.underscore

column2: 1.--Italian Tongue.
column3: one.--Italian Tongue.

column2: Boil a beef tongue until tender; skin and slice thin.
column3: Boil a beef tongue until tender; skin and slice thin.

column2: Heat 2 tablespoonfuls of butter.
column3: Heat two tablespoonfuls of butter.

column2: Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves of garlic minced fine.
column3: Add one chopped onion and two cloves of garlic minced fine.

column2: Stir in 1 tablespoonful of flour until brown; add a little water, 1 cup of tomato-sauce, 1/2 cup chopped mushrooms, lemon-juice, salt and pepper to taste.
column3: Stir in one tablespoonful of flour until brown; add a little water, one cup of tomato sauce, one half cup chopped mushrooms, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Let boil.
column3: Let boil.

column2: Add the sliced tongue, and 1/2 glass of sherry wine.
column3: Add the sliced tongue, and one half glass of sherry wine.

column2: Simmer ten minutes.
column3: Simmer ten minutes.

column2: Serve with baked macaroni.
column3: Serve with baked macaroni.

column2: 2.--German Prune Pudding.
column3: two.--German Prune Pudding.

column2: Cook 1 pound of prunes in a large saucepan with sliced lemon, a piece of stick cinnamon and brown sugar.
column3: Cook one pound of prunes in a large saucepan with sliced lemon, a piece of stick cinnamon and brown sugar.

column2: Soak 1/2 loaf of bread in water; press out dry.
column3: Soak one half loaf of bread in water; press out dry.

column2: Add 3 eggs, 1/4 teaspoonful each of cinnamon, cloves and allspice.
column3: Add three eggs, one quarter teaspoonful each of cinnamon, cloves and allspice.

column2: Add flour sifted with a teaspoonful of baking-powder. Make into a large roll; place in the centre of the prunes; cover with brown sugar and a tablespoonful of molasses and put in the oven to bake until done.
column3: Add flour sifted with a teaspoonful of baking powder. Make into a large roll; place in the centre of the prunes; cover with brown sugar and a tablespoonful of molasses and put in the oven to bake until done.

column2: Serve hot or cold.
column3: Serve hot or cold.

column2: 3.--Swiss Pot Roast.
column3: three.--Swiss Pot Roast.

column2: Season a breast of veal with salt, pepper and ginger.
column3: Season a breast of veal with salt, pepper and ginger.

column2: Heat a cupful of dripping; lay the meat in the stew-pan with the dripping, 1 onion, some celery seed, carroway seed, a few peppercorns and parsley.
column3: Heat a cupful of dripping; lay the meat in the stew pan with the dripping, one onion, some celery seed, carroway seed, a few peppercorns and parsley.

column2: Cover and let stew slowly until nearly done; then add 1 cup of tomato-sauce and cook slowly until tender.
column3: Cover and let stew slowly until nearly done; then add one cup of tomato sauce and cook slowly until tender.

column2: Serve with baked potatoes.
column3: Serve with baked potatoes.

column2: 4.--Mushrooms a la Bordelaise.
column3: four.--Mushrooms a la Bordelaise.

column2: Drain 1 can of mushrooms; chop 6 shallots very fine and saute in 1 tablespoonful of butter.
column3: Drain one can of mushrooms; chop six shallots very fine and saute in one tablespoonful of butter.

column2: Add the chopped mushrooms; sprinkle with salt, pepper, some chopped parsley and 1 minced bay-leaf.
column3: Add the chopped mushrooms; sprinkle with salt, pepper, some chopped parsley and one minced bay leaf.

column2: Let cook ten minutes with 1/2 glass of sherry wine.
column3: Let cook ten minutes with one half glass of sherry wine.

column2: Serve hot on slices of French toast.
column3: Serve hot on slices of French toast.

column2: 5.--Turkish Soup.
column3: five.--Turkish Soup.

column2: Season and fry some lamb chops; add 2 green peppers sliced thin, 1 onion chopped and an herb bouquet.
column3: Season and fry some lamb chops; add two green peppers sliced thin, one onion chopped and an herb bouquet.

column2: Then cook 1/2 cup of barley in 1 quart of soup stock until tender.
column3: Then cook one half cup of barley in one quart of soup stock until tender.

column2: Pour all together and let cook until meat is very tender.
column3: Pour all together and let cook until meat is very tender.

column2: Serve hot.
column3: Serve hot.

column2: 6.--Scotch Omelet.
column3: six.--Scotch Omelet.

column2: Boil young tender leeks in salted water; let drain.
column3: Boil young tender leeks in salted water; let drain.

column2: Chop to a fine mince and fry in hot butter.
column3: Chop to a fine mince and fry in hot butter.

column2: Add 6 well-beaten eggs, sprinkle with salt and pepper and fold into an omelet and serve on a hot dish.
column3: Add six well beaten eggs, sprinkle with salt and pepper and fold into an omelet and serve on a hot dish.

column2: 7.--Jewish Egg Bread.
column3: seven.--Jewish Egg Bread.

column2: Soak some matzoths in milk for a few minutes; then dip them into seasoned beaten eggs.
column3: Soak some matzoths in milk for a few minutes; then dip them into seasoned beaten eggs.

column2: Add a pinch of sugar and let them fry in hot rendered butter until a golden brown.
column3: Add a pinch of sugar and let them fry in hot rendered butter until a golden brown.

column2: Sprinkle with pulverized sugar and cinnamon and serve hot with coffee.
column3: Sprinkle with pulverized sugar and cinnamon and serve hot with coffee.

column2: 8.--Bombay Broiled Kidney.
column3: eight.--Bombay Broiled Kidney.

column2: Clean sheep's kidneys and cut into thin slices.
column3: Clean sheep's kidneys and cut into thin slices.

column2: Sprinkle with salt, cayenne pepper and grated lemon peel.
column3: Sprinkle with salt, cayenne pepper and grated lemon peel.

column2: Then dip in beaten egg and fine bread-crumbs and broil on a hot greased gridiron.
column3: Then dip in beaten egg and fine bread crumbs and broil on a hot greased gridiron.

column2: Serve on buttered toast, spread with curry paste.
column3: Serve on buttered toast, spread with curry paste.

column2: 9.--German Prune Kuchen.
column3: nine.--German Prune Kuchen.

column2: Boil some prunes until tender.
column3: Boil some prunes until tender.

column2: Remove the kernels and mash the prunes well.
column3: Remove the kernels and mash the prunes well.

column2: Mix with sugar, cinnamon and lemon-juice to taste.
column3: Mix with sugar, cinnamon and lemon juice to taste.

column2: Make a rich biscuit dough, roll out and place on a well-buttered baking-pan.
column3: Make a rich biscuit dough, roll out and place on a well buttered baking pan.

column2: Fill with the prunes and let bake until done.
column3: Fill with the prunes and let bake until done.

column2: Serve cold.
column3: Serve cold.

column2: 10.--French Roast with Carrots.
column3: ten.--French Roast with Carrots.

column2: Lard a round of beef with slices of bacon and put in a large saucepan. Cover and let brown a few minutes.
column3: Lard a round of beef with slices of bacon and put in a large saucepan. Cover and let brown a few minutes.

column2: Add sliced onion and boiling water to cover.
column3: Add sliced onion and boiling water to cover.

column2: Let cook slowly until tender; then scrape 6 carrots and cut thin; add 2 sliced onions, 2 cloves of garlic and let cook until tender.
column3: Let cook slowly until tender; then scrape six carrots and cut thin; add two sliced onions, two cloves of garlic and let cook until tender.

column2: Thicken with butter and flour.
column3: Thicken with butter and flour.

column2: Season highly with salt, pepper and parsley; add to the meat, and let all cook together a half hour and serve hot.
column3: Season highly with salt, pepper and parsley; add to the meat, and let all cook together a half hour and serve hot.

column2: 11.--Spanish Fried Chicken.
column3: eleven.--Spanish Fried Chicken.

column2: Cut a fat hen into pieces at the joints and boil until tender; season and fry with 1 onion and 2 green peppers chopped fine.
column3: Cut a fat hen into pieces at the joints and boil until tender; season and fry with one onion and two green peppers chopped fine.

column2: Add 1 cup of tomato-sauce, salt and pepper to taste.
column3: Add one cup of tomato sauce, salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Serve the chicken on a platter with boiled rice.
column3: Serve the chicken on a platter with boiled rice.

column2: 12.--Hungarian Bread Pudding.
column3: twelve.--Hungarian Bread Pudding.

column2: Chop 1/2 cup of suet.
column3: Chop one half cup of suet.

column2: Mix with 1/2 loaf of stale bread that has been soaked and pressed dry.
column3: Mix with one half loaf of stale bread that has been soaked and pressed dry.

column2: Add 1 cup of chopped apples, 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of chopped raisins and nuts.
column3: Add one cup of chopped apples, one cup of sugar, one half cup of chopped raisins and nuts.

column2: Sprinkle with cinnamon, nutmeg and grated lemon peel; then mix with the yolks of 4 eggs and the whites beaten stiff.
column3: Sprinkle with cinnamon, nutmeg and grated lemon peel; then mix with the yolks of four eggs and the whites beaten stiff.

column2: Put in a well-buttered pudding-dish, and let bake until done.
column3: Put in a well buttered pudding dish, and let bake until done.

column2: Serve hot with wine sauce.
column3: Serve hot with wine sauce.

column2: 13.--Swedish Baked Turnips.
column3: thirteen.--Swedish Baked Turnips.

column2: Peel small tender turnips; heat 1 tablespoonful of butter in a saucepan.
column3: Peel small tender turnips; heat one tablespoonful of butter in a saucepan.

column2: Place the turnips in whole, sprinkle with salt and pepper; add a tablespoonful of sugar.
column3: Place the turnips in whole, sprinkle with salt and pepper; add a tablespoonful of sugar.

column2: Pour over a cup of water; cover and let cook for one hour until tender but not broken.
column3: Pour over a cup of water; cover and let cook for one hour until tender but not broken.

column2: Thicken the sauce with flour and milk.
column3: Thicken the sauce with flour and milk.

column2: Add a little water and set in the oven a half hour, covered with paper; then serve.
column3: Add a little water and set in the oven a half hour, covered with paper; then serve.

column2: 14.--Belgian Baked Bananas.
column3: fourteen.--Belgian Baked Bananas.

column2: Skin fine bananas and lay them whole in a baking-dish.
column3: Skin fine bananas and lay them whole in a baking dish.

column2: Sprinkle with sugar and grated lemon peel.
column3: Sprinkle with sugar and grated lemon peel.

column2: Add the juice of 1 orange, 1/2 lemon and 1/2 glass of sherry wine.
column3: Add the juice of one orange, one half lemon and one half glass of sherry wine.

column2: Let bake in a quick oven.
column3: Let bake in a quick oven.

column2: Put the bananas in a glass dish and pour over the sauce.
column3: Put the bananas in a glass dish and pour over the sauce.

column2: Let get cold and serve.
column3: Let get cold and serve.

column2: 15.--Japanese Rice.
column3: fifteen.--Japanese Rice.

column2: Boil 1 cup of rice; add 3 chopped shallots, 1 teaspoonful of soy and salt to taste.
column3: Boil one cup of rice; add three chopped shallots, one teaspoonful of soy and salt to taste.

column2: Place on a platter, cover with chopped hard-boiled eggs, sprinkle with salt, paprica and chopped parsley.
column3: Place on a platter, cover with chopped hard boiled eggs, sprinkle with salt, paprica and chopped parsley.

column2: Garnish with some thin slices of smoked salmon.
column3: Garnish with some thin slices of smoked salmon.

column2: 16.--Scotch Loaf Cake.
column3: sixteen.--Scotch Loaf Cake.

column2: Mix 1/2 pound of butter with 1/4 pound of sugar, 1/2 cup of chopped nuts and 1/2 cup of shredded citron; then work in 1 pound of sifted flour with 2 teaspoonfuls of baking-powder.
column3: Mix one half pound of butter with one quarter pound of sugar, one half cup of chopped nuts and one half cup of shredded citron; then work in one pound of sifted flour with two teaspoonfuls of baking powder.

column2: Make a loaf a half inch thick and bake in a moderate oven until done.
column3: Make a loaf a half inch thick and bake in a moderate oven until done.

column2: 17.--English Meat Loaf.
column3: seventeen.--English Meat Loaf.

column2: Chop cooked veal and boiled ham; place in a well-greased mold alternate layers of veal, ham and hard-boiled eggs.
column3: Chop cooked veal and boiled ham; place in a well greased mold alternate layers of veal, ham and hard boiled eggs.

column2: Sprinkle with pepper, mace and chopped parsley.
column3: Sprinkle with pepper, mace and chopped parsley.

column2: Moisten with beef-stock and let bake in the oven.
column3: Moisten with beef stock and let bake in the oven.

column2: Serve cold, sliced very thin, garnished with watercress.
column3: Serve cold, sliced very thin, garnished with watercress.

column2: 18.--Jewish Purim Cakes.
column3: eighteen.--Jewish Purim Cakes.

column2: Beat 1 cup of sugar with 1/2 cup of butter to a cream; add 2 beaten eggs, a pinch of salt, 1/2 cup of milk and the grated peel of 1/2 lemon.
column3: Beat one cup of sugar with one half cup of butter to a cream; add two beaten eggs, a pinch of salt, one half cup of milk and the grated peel of one half lemon.

column2: Add enough sifted flour with 1 teaspoonful of baking-powder to make a soft biscuit dough.
column3: Add enough sifted flour with one teaspoonful of baking powder to make a soft biscuit dough.

column2: Put on a well-floured baking-board.
column3: Put on a well floured baking board.

column2: Roll out a half inch thick.
column3: Roll out a half inch thick.

column2: Cut into triangles and drop in a kettle of hot rendered butter; fry until a golden brown.
column3: Cut into triangles and drop in a kettle of hot rendered butter; fry until a golden brown.

column2: Then mix some powdered sugar with a little milk and flavor with vanilla.
column3: Then mix some powdered sugar with a little milk and flavor with vanilla.

column2: Spread on the top.
column3: Spread on the top.

column2: 19.--Swiss Pie.
column3: nineteen.--Swiss Pie.

column2: Make a rich pie-dough.
column3: Make a rich pie dough.

column2: Line a buttered pie-dish with the dough; then slice three onions very thin and let cook in hot butter until tender; add a pinch of salt.
column3: Line a buttered pie dish with the dough; then slice three onions very thin and let cook in hot butter until tender; add a pinch of salt.

column2: Fill the pie with the onions, cover the top with cream and let bake in a moderate oven until done.
column3: Fill the pie with the onions, cover the top with cream and let bake in a moderate oven until done.

column2: Serve hot or cold.
column3: Serve hot or cold.

column2: 20.--French Apple Fritters.
column3: twenty.--French Apple Fritters.

column2: Peel and slice large apples; sprinkle with sugar and lemon-juice and make a rich egg batter.
column3: Peel and slice large apples; sprinkle with sugar and lemon juice and make a rich egg batter.

column2: Sweeten to taste and flavor with 2 tablespoonfuls of orange-flower water.
column3: Sweeten to taste and flavor with two tablespoonfuls of orange flower water.

column2: Lay the sliced apples in the batter and fry in deep hot lard to a golden brown.
column3: Lay the sliced apples in the batter and fry in deep hot lard to a golden brown.

column2: Serve with wine sauce.
column3: Serve with wine sauce.

column2: 21.--Jewish Purim Torte.
column3: twenty one.--Jewish Purim Torte.

column2: Line a well-buttered baking-dish with a rich pie-paste.
column3: Line a well buttered baking dish with a rich pie paste.

column2: Then mix 1 cup of fine poppy-seeds with the yolks of 5 eggs and 1/2 cup of sugar, some chopped raisins and nuts and the juice of 1/2 lemon.
column3: Then mix one cup of fine poppy seeds with the yolks of five eggs and one half cup of sugar, some chopped raisins and nuts and the juice of one half lemon.

column2: Add the whites beaten stiff; then fill with the mixture and let bake until done.
column3: Add the whites beaten stiff; then fill with the mixture and let bake until done.

column2: 22.--English Boiled Pudding.
column3: twenty two.--English Boiled Pudding.

column2: Mix 1/2 pound of butter with 1/2 pound of powdered sugar to a cream. Add the yolks of 6 eggs beaten, 1/2 cup of seeded raisins and some chopped citron, a pinch of nutmeg and cinnamon.
column3: Mix one half pound of butter with one half pound of powdered sugar to a cream. Add the yolks of six eggs beaten, one half cup of seeded raisins and some chopped citron, a pinch of nutmeg and cinnamon.

column2: Mix in 1/2 pound of sifted flour and 1/2 teaspoonful of baking-powder.
column3: Mix in one half pound of sifted flour and one half teaspoonful of baking powder.

column2: Add the whites, beaten to a stiff froth; put in a buttered pudding-mold, and let boil until done.
column3: Add the whites, beaten to a stiff froth; put in a buttered pudding mold, and let boil until done.

column2: Serve with brandy sauce.
column3: Serve with brandy sauce.

column2: 23.--German Stewed Brains.
column3: twenty three.--German Stewed Brains.

column2: Clean the brains.
column3: Clean the brains.

column2: Heat 1 tablespoonful of drippings in a pan; add the brains, 1 sliced onion, some parsley, salt and pepper.
column3: Heat one tablespoonful of drippings in a pan; add the brains, one sliced onion, some parsley, salt and pepper.

column2: Let stew fifteen minutes.
column3: Let stew fifteen minutes.

column2: Thicken the sauce with butter and flour; let boil up. Serve hot with spinach and sprinkle all with chopped hard-boiled eggs.
column3: Thicken the sauce with butter and flour; let boil up. Serve hot with spinach and sprinkle all with chopped hard boiled eggs.

column2: 24.--Scotch Cream Muffins.
column3: twenty four.--Scotch Cream Muffins.

column2: Sift 1 pint of flour with 1 teaspoonful of baking-powder; beat three yolks of eggs with a pinch of salt; add 1 pint of cream and 1 tablespoonful of melted butter.
column3: Sift one pint of flour with one teaspoonful of baking powder; beat three yolks of eggs with a pinch of salt; add one pint of cream and one tablespoonful of melted butter.

column2: Stir in the flour; add the whites beaten to a stiff froth.
column3: Stir in the flour; add the whites beaten to a stiff froth.

column2: Beat all well together.
column3: Beat all well together.

column2: Fill the muffin-rings 1/2 full and bake in a quick oven for twenty minutes.
column3: Fill the muffin rings one half full and bake in a quick oven for twenty minutes.

column2: 25.--French Tart.
column3: twenty five.--French Tart.

column2: Make a rich pie-dough.
column3: Make a rich pie dough.

column2: Line a large pie-dish with the paste and bake. Take 3 ounces of almonds and pound to a paste; add 3 tablespoonfuls of pulverized sugar, 2 tablespoonfuls of melted butter, 1/2 teaspoonful of cinnamon and the yolks of 2 eggs well beaten with 1 tablespoonful of rum.
column3: Line a large pie dish with the paste and bake. Take three ounces of almonds and pound to a paste; add three tablespoonfuls of pulverized sugar, two tablespoonfuls of melted butter, one half teaspoonful of cinnamon and the yolks of two eggs well beaten with one tablespoonful of rum.

column2: Add the beaten whites; fill the pie and bake in a moderate oven.
column3: Add the beaten whites; fill the pie and bake in a moderate oven.

column2: Then make a glace.
column3: Then make a glace.

column2: Mix 1 ounce of granulated sugar with 1 tablespoonful of cold water and let come to a boil.
column3: Mix one ounce of granulated sugar with one tablespoonful of cold water and let come to a boil.

column2: Put on the pie when cool and serve.
column3: Put on the pie when cool and serve.

column2: 26.--Polish Stewed Beans.
column3: twenty six.--Polish Stewed Beans.

column2: Break string-beans into pieces and let boil in salted water until tender; then heat 1 tablespoonful of butter; stir in 1 tablespoonful of flour until brown.
column3: Break string beans into pieces and let boil in salted water until tender; then heat one tablespoonful of butter; stir in one tablespoonful of flour until brown.

column2: Add the water in which the beans were cooked, 1/2 cup of vinegar, 1 tablespoonful of brown sugar, some cinnamon and cloves to taste.
column3: Add the water in which the beans were cooked, one half cup of vinegar, one tablespoonful of brown sugar, some cinnamon and cloves to taste.

column2: Let sauce boil.
column3: Let sauce boil.

column2: Add the beans and simmer ten minutes. Serve hot with a beef pot roast.
column3: Add the beans and simmer ten minutes. Serve hot with a beef pot roast.

column2: 27.--Vienna Milk Rolls.
column3: twenty seven.--Vienna Milk Rolls.

column2: Sift 1-1/2 quarts of flour; add 1/2 teaspoonful of salt; work in a large tablespoonful of butter; then stir in 1/2 cup of milk with a piece of yeast dissolved in the milk and a teaspoonful of sugar.
column3: Sift one to half a quart of flour; add one half teaspoonful of salt; work in a large tablespoonful of butter; then stir in one half cup of milk with a piece of yeast dissolved in the milk and a teaspoonful of sugar.

column2: Beat all up well with 1 pint of milk; let raise over night.
column3: Beat all up well with one pint of milk; let raise over night.

column2: Roll out an inch thick; cut with a biscuit-cutter; rub with melted butter; lay in a buttered baking-pan; let raise one hour; then bake in a hot oven twenty minutes.
column3: Roll out an inch thick; cut with a biscuit cutter; rub with melted butter; lay in a buttered baking pan; let raise one hour; then bake in a hot oven twenty minutes.

column2: 28.--Scotch Potato Stew.
column3: twenty eight.--Scotch Potato Stew.

column2: Cut the potatoes into small dice pieces and fry in hot lard.
column3: Cut the potatoes into small dice pieces and fry in hot lard.

column2: Then fry 1 onion cut fine in hot butter, but do not brown; stir in some flour; then add milk, salt, pepper and parsley.
column3: Then fry one onion cut fine in hot butter, but do not brown; stir in some flour; then add milk, salt, pepper and parsley.

column2: Let boil up once and add the potatoes to the sauce.
column3: Let boil up once and add the potatoes to the sauce.

column2: Let all get very hot and serve.
column3: Let all get very hot and serve.

column2: 29.--Jewish Dumplings.
column3: twenty nine.--Jewish Dumplings.

column2: Soak 6 crackers in water; then press dry.
column3: Soak six crackers in water; then press dry.

column2: Fry 1 chopped onion in butter and pour over the crackers.
column3: Fry one chopped onion in butter and pour over the crackers.

column2: Add 3 eggs and chopped parsley; sprinkle with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
column3: Add three eggs and chopped parsley; sprinkle with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

column2: Mix all with some cracker-meal until you can form into balls and boil in salted water until done. Serve hot with melted butter poured over them, and garnish with parsley.
column3: Mix all with some cracker meal until you can form into balls and boil in salted water until done. Serve hot with melted butter poured over them, and garnish with parsley.

column2: 30.--Italian Soup.
column3: thirty.--Italian Soup.

column2: Chop some cabbage and let fry in 2 tablespoonfuls of butter; add 1/2 cup of rice (dry) and 1 clove of garlic chopped with 1/2 small onion. Let fry a few minutes; then add 2 quarts of soup-stock seasoned with salt, white pepper and a little saffron to taste.
column3: Chop some cabbage and let fry in two tablespoonfuls of butter; add one half cup of rice (dry) and one clove of garlic chopped with one half small onion. Let fry a few minutes; then add two quarts of soup stock seasoned with salt, white pepper and a little saffron to taste.

column2: Add 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese; let all cook until done.
column3: Add one half cup of grated Parmesan cheese; let all cook until done.

column2: Serve with toasted croutons.
column3: Serve with toasted croutons.
